name: Trianon Palace Versailles, A Waldorf Astoria Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I were doing a 6 week tour across Europe. Put simply, this hotel was not central to anything, people were not helpful and very rude (except the concierge who was probably the sweetest lady ever!), and I found a cockroach in the lobby. It was beautiful but not worth the money. We asked for a double bed and instead they pushed two singles together. We noticed this quite often on our journey but for $900.00 a night you think they would manage to be able to have a double bed! Again the main inconvenience was the location. It was a 1 hour long trip to Paris by train and although Versailles was nice I would recommend for no one to bother doing a over night trip there. There is not much to see besides the Palace.Also the food was very far away and everything closes very early. We found ourselves wishing we had stayed in Paris at Hotel innova which was much cheaper (this is where we stayed the previous two nights we had been there).Overall this hotel was just not worth the money especially for the long trip into Paris. The only good thing was that it was only a 50.00 cab ride to the airport.
reviews.title: Not worth the buck!

likes.liked: — The rooms were large but nothing much to look at.

reviews.title: In need of an overhaul
reviews.text: This hotel is in an enviable location- just beside the parkland surrounding the Chateau of Versailles. You can see the sheep graze from the windows of the restaurantas you eat breakfast. Walk outside the hotel gate and you're at the entrance to the Chateau park - and what a park !

reviews.title: Not the "palace" I expected but still very comfortable ...
reviews.text: It should be idyllic but it isn't. The hotel is tired, the decor faded and jaded, and this seems to have infected some of the staff. The maids seem to lack motivation; some of the bar staff are charmless; and the breakfast room looks as though it has been arranged by someone determined to sap your appetite. Even the fine swimming pool looks as though it could do with a lick of paint and a new set of furniture.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great pity because with a bit of care, attention, and initiative, I'm sure this hotel could be the sort of place that would sweep you off your feet and make you want to come back year after year.
reviews.title: Big room but poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2004, traveled with family
reviews.text: I suspect the problem lies with management. The sad thing is that mangement appear to concentrate on the conference trade - the hotel's activities appear to revolve around the various groups meeting there - which is not what you'd expect when you read the blurb on the Westin website.
reviews.title: Overpriced

likes.liked: — The close proximatey to the Palace and to Paris.
likes.disliked: — The price of the meals, ridiculous breakfast prices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you do not have a car, you might want to look for more convenient location. There is no hotel shuttle service. When we arrived at the train station, we looked for a taxi. There were no taxis at the train station. The information desk could not get us one and suggested that we would have to walk. It took us about 20 min pulling our luggages down cobblestone sidewalks to get to the hotel.
reviews.title: Day one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were give a room in the plaza bldg. It is not like a five star price or rating at all. The room was tiny and has musty smell. Shower's water pressure was low and sink drain is slow. The heating did not work properly. We reported all these problems, however, water pressure(slightly better) and thermestat were NOT corrected. We turned the heater off and the windows open to stay cool.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Concierge(Helene) got us strainted at a local mall after she sent us to the local mall. She told us to call her for a taxi for the return trip and she gave us her card. We watched the store receptionist called the hotel multiple times. The hotel told her that no taxi could be found and will stopping for a taxi. After hour and half, a store employee felt sorry for us and drove us back to the hotel. We let the concierge(Helene) know, and she totally denied about the calls. At a later time, we received an anonymous note from the concierge's desk.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After the taxi incident, we were so tired. We decided to order room service. As we were ordering our room service dinner, a waiter showed up with a complimentary bottle of wine. While he was in our room, we called the room service and cancelled the wine that we just ordered. In about ten mins, the same waiter showed up with the dinner with wine that he heard us cancelled. We told him that we did not want the wine and asked him to take it back. He went ahead and open it anyway and then handed it us the room service bill. This shows complete disregard of what guests want.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hopefully, day two goes better.....
reviews.title: Fabulous property with below par service.
Reasonable
reviews.text: Reasonable location for the palace and reasonable prices for the rooms. Meals and drinks very expensive though. Rooms pleasant and spacious, but have electronic mini-bars so there is no space to store your own drinks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I arrived after a 15 hour flight at 11:00 a.m. really hoping to take a nap only to find that a room wasn't available. Fair enough. Check in time was 3:00, but they told me to come back at 2:00 p.m. and they'd likely have my room ready. The front desk offered to store my luggage, and I went down and enjoyed the pretty pool and spa area for no supplemental charge. I went back up at 2:00 and a room was still not available. I was asked to come back at 3:00. Rooms still were not available at 3:00, They finally had a room for me at 4:30, they gave me a key, and I went up to a room that was already occupied by a work colleague who happened to be working at his computer in his underwear. Embarrassing for him, I'm sure. They then apologized when I went down to the front desk, and later delivered an apology letter and a complimentary bottle of wine, but they delivered these items to another of my colleague's rooms. Bar service out on the patio on 3 occasions was incredibly slow. Still, enjoyed my stay...beautiful corner room with abundant light and a balcony overlooking forest/pastures on one side and the Versailles Palace on the other. Room was very modern and spacious. I was there for a 4-day business meeting, and the meeting areas were light and airy with windows in all. Occasional air-conditioning problems, so we'd open up windows but delivery trucks and buses were too noisy and distracting so we'd close the windows back up to be able to hear and quickly heat back up.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, service uncharacteristic of what you might expect from Waldorf=Astoria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't even have time for the grounds, so much to do locally.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms are great, even if in the opposite block and not the actual hotel, food is excellent, service is excellent.
reviews.title: Could do better for a 4-star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a special rate on lastminute website and the hotel was well worth the price - especially when we saw the normal rates.
reviews.title: I won't hesitate to stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Right next to Versailles Palace gardens, so great for the sightseeeing. Further tomwalk into town than some hotels, but I still wouldn't stay anywhere else
reviews.title: could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: The Trianon Palace Versailles is a stunning looking hotel both inside and out. We were in the more modern out building and I have to say that the room was OK but nothing special. I have certainly stayed in much nicer rooms. It was pleasant and very functional but not particularly large. It reminded me of a quite good business hotel room rather than a luxurious room.
reviews.title: Exceptionally beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was the hotel itself which was beautiful and the breakfast room was simply gorgeous - as was the breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The valet parking was a pain because we were staying at this hotel on our way down to the Dordogne. This meant we had a vehicle full of stuff and when we pulled up in front of the hotel there was a gentleman there to take our keys. This resulted in a mad scramble to get all of the bits and pieces that we wanted for the night. Very inelegant. We had to go back to the car twice and rather than just give us the keys, the valet had to accompany us back to our vehicle, unlock it for us and then lock it again after we had retrieved whatever it was we wanted from the car. A little embarrassing. If you don't have a high people carrier with a top box on then you can use the underground parking beneath the new out building.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel perfectly placed for a visit to the Palace of Versailles and Trianon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a lovely hotel.
reviews.title: not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall Comments: Excellent hotel, hard to fault.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was there on a business visit ---as part of a large group of senior Directors, with the wives! And we stayed three nights !
reviews.title: Great location and fabulous ambience---but only average service !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: The location, the gardens and the overall ambience were simply marvellous! In the heart of Marseilles, such greenery and expansive lawns and trees all around the Hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in a beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was generally good---but as vegetarians from India, our options were rather limited. The restaurants, and the breakfast hall had excellent view of the gardens !
reviews.title: Good stay - Unfortunately not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: But the service was rather disappointing. The luggage had to be largely handled by ourselves---unless we were willing to wait a long time ! Most frustrating was when the Hotel Reception had wrongly coded the timelimits on our electronic keys---and about 10-12 of us, returning at midnight, had to walk over 200 metres across the gardens from the other block---to the Front Office-- to get the keys recoded ! And the staff did not even have the courtesy to apologise ! They merely said that someone had made a mistake and they would correct it ! Rather unbecoming of Waldorf Astoria standards !
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay here last summer and I would highly recommend it as a destination aside from Paris, perhaps stay here for a couple of nights while visiting the capital or even a few days like we did.
reviews.title: The closest you can get to being Louis XIV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved every thing. We were there in a suite with a park view.
reviews.title: lovely get away and we ll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: we loved the restaurant, the bar.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel for a visit to Versailles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: there s also some litlle restaurants around with good food and not expensive.
reviews.title: The best, most romantic hotel ever. We will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: When you get to the hotel it s like nothing else matter. you forget all.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only thing that matters was the moment we spent there and us.
reviews.title: SUPERB

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you ever get Room no. 524 at this Hotel, dont even bother going to that room. We were in for a shocker when the door was opened. A room, not even big than a closet, broken ceiling light and an air condition controller that gave sparks (!!) when temperature was adjusted. I am a HHonors Diamond VIP and this was certainly not an upgrade, it was a downgrade in fact.
reviews.title: Stay got better after initial disppointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: I had to go down to the reception with our luggage and told them that I'll stay in the lobby if they cant find me a better room. Well, their brains saw the light of the day and gave us a much better room.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel overlooking the gardens of Trianon Versailles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Trianon Palace is a wonderful hotel. The hotel grounds are massive lush of greenfields and is a sight to see. Location is a bit sketchy 'cos its far away from any kind of public transportation. Special mention to the Concierge, Monsieur Frank, who should be the Manager 'cos he takes charge, delegates and runs things very well.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are arriving by train at Rive Gauche Versailles it may be best to take a taxi, 6 euros to the hotel. The taxi stand is as you exit on the left.
reviews.title: Gordon Ramsey Kitchen Nightmares starts here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and a perfect mix of old and new. The reception area and main verandah are filled with interesting chairs.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have visited the Trianon Palace a few times. The New Year's Package end of December 2011 was good, but the management of the hotel could have prepared better. There was a serious lack of coordination of everything that was going on. The kitchen could produce little wonders but there were too many guests and mistakes did happen. The staff is always friendly in this hotel, which is very clean with nice atmosphere and French elegance. If you are looking for a little getaway or somewhere to stay to visit the Palace of Versailles, this is the ideal place to stay if you like comfort and can affort a 4-star hotel. The Trianon Palace is literally at one of the entrances of the Palace of Versailles gardens.
reviews.title: Do you like to visit gardens? Stay here, in spring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: A question: The New Year's Eve package included a so called VIP gift. When we received it it was nothing more than a paper bag containing a couple of chocolates and sweets. Seriously now, did it have to be called a VIP gift?
reviews.title: Best way to visit varsailles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I really hope that the hotel management considers these comments when planning their future festive packages. It is such a waste to have everything: Good food, good service, great location and surrounding, nice establishment, comfortable bedrooms and hotel areas and have everything spoiled by the fact that none of these are coordinated.
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Friends at Trianon Palace: You are doing a good job, but could do so, so much better!
reviews.title: Good quality business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very elegant hitel, the spa is amazing! Both restaurants, la veranda and gordon ramsey are great!! A must when you visit paris!
reviews.title: Excellent location and great food. Beautiful property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed 3 nights at the Trianon Palace and all we can say is "now we know what it was like to live like a king". The hotel is superb in every fasion - furniture, decorations, grounds, the staff - all up to Waldorf standards. The concierge was wonderful and had excellent English skills. The location can't be beat, right next to the gate of the Palace grounds. We went in winter which was nice because it was not crowded and strolling around the palace and gardens was easy. The hotel is quite historic in its own right, as the Treaty of Versailles was negotiated there. The meal we had at Gordon Ramsay au Trianon was better than Le Jules Verne in the Eiffel Tower (Alain Ducasse) or Michael Mina's in the Bellagio - a treat from start to finish! Their website says it all - "Experience The Legendary Grandeur Of Versailles" - you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Luxury, charm, beauty, location - you get it all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is billed as a luxury, legendary hotel - for us this was a special occasion visit. However depending on which web site you book on, it may not be clear that the property consists of the historic hotel and a separate modern Pavilion conference centre. The rooms are a bit cheaper in the Pavilion, but the main attraction for us would be to stay in the historic building, not a rather anonymous modern building across the garden. It was therefore a disappointment to arrive and find we were in the Pavilion rather than the hotel and could not change rooms.
reviews.title: A Tale of Two Buildings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: The staff in reception and the hallway cafe, I would describe as willing, but often unable. We had difficulties in getting the correct rooms, wrong food orders and lost baggage, but they were always courteous and friendly.
reviews.title: Delightful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel interiors are outstanding, the location is perfect for visiting Versailles. For us the biggest asset was Gordon Ramsey's restaurant at the hotel - the food was beyond expectations and service was great. We did book the chef's table and so perhaps had extra special attention, but it was fantastic having personal attention from the head chef.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel in a beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at Trianon Palace immediately greeted and escorted to check in. Being Diamond received upgrade and escorted quickly to room. great accommodations and location is nice and peaceful - just what we needed after Paris! Five minute walk to Chateau Versailles and shops nearby. Love it.
reviews.title: A true 5 star hotel, brilliantly situated for visiting Versailles

description: Distinctive Grand-style Palace & Pavillion building situated in 8-acre park bordering the Palace of Versailles.
